Articles.Content:
Hi guys

I want to set up a small add-on making team. I don't really care who gets credit for what, but all our names will be mentioned when we're finished.

Basically, what I need is:

  • 1 3d artist
  • 1 Texturer
  • 1 Cfg editor

(Key:

Green = Spot is filled, but another spot is possible

Red = All slots are filled for this type, we are no longer looking for more people for this job

Purple = Position is empty

)

I have a few mod packs in mind, but no one will be the leader of this team, we all have the same imput, and if there's any mod pack you want created, we can discuss it with everyone on the team and decide weather or not to do it.

PM me if you're interested (preferably with a picture of your work, unless you're wanting to be a cfg file person)

This is great opportunity for those of you that can only do one thing (only texturing or only modeling etc etc..) but have some good add-on ideas.

Edited August 25, 2012 by XOOM

I support this kind of co-operation. Anyone who thinks the same long XOOM lines should just join. (To bad I can't help you out since I have my own team )

But if you need advice how to run a mod-team, you are welcome to nock on my door.
I have an organisation that u all can join! Keep checking in on this page: http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/17771-Invention-A-new-Kerbal-Organisation

I support this kind of co-operation. Anyone who thinks the same long XOOM lines should just join. (To bad I can't help you out since I have my own team )

But if you need advice how to run a mod-team, you are welcome to nock on my door.

I'll be sure to ask you if/when I get the team assembled
XOOM, start small, don't start off with 5 people straight away.

XOOM, start small, don't start off with 5 people straight away.

You dont really need a dedicated tester, since you and the others you work with can test it, and you can throw out an alpha release to the masses to test/break.

Advice was taken into account, thanks guys

Starting off with 3 or 4 should be good.
How I started is just starting with something... just make anything up. Doesn't have to be the biggest project ever, people will come along.

Yeah, I have a few add-on packs in mind. But at the moment my knowledge of blender is fairly limited. I can make almost any thing, but more then likely it won't look great, but hey, practice makes perfect .

I'm also asking anyone who inquires what they may want to develop, that way we have a wide range of ideas, and every ones input is equal. As I said, no one is in charge of the team.

And thanks for all the advice Dani-Sang, it has really helped
yw - I will send a PM with some other advices to get your started the right way.
